page.title: 18DARTMOUTH PLAYERS
page.content: The{Dartmouth Players}was founded by {Cyril Maud}in 1926 after he retired from his career in London as an actor and impresario. The first productions were held in{"the Barn"}in Stoke Fleming but later moved to Dartmouth where all productions are now held in the{Guildhall. Today it has more than{70 members and produces 5 productions a year. Well known musicals have been the most popular such as "KISS ME KATE", "OKLAHOMA",and "MY FAIR LADY", which have pulled in audiences of up to{1600 people a week. This year's productions include, {"THE BEAR"}by Chekov,{"THE FARMDALE {MURDER MYSTERY"}and{"OLIVER".
